@Beep Boop As someone who has been on the receiving end of false accusations you would see how easy it is for a man to have is life destroyed based on one false statement. You are assumed guilty until proven innocent. While i think abusers should get the full extent of the law, there should be due process and if a woman is found to be making false accusations they should get the same length of sentence the abuser would have got. In most cases, women don't get any charges brought against them after they make false accusations, even under oath. There was a case recently here in Ireland, A 70 year old man was accused of assaulting a woman, turns out there was CCTV footage that showed that it could not have happened but yet she still claimed she was assaulted, on the stand. The woman was not charged with anything after, she got to walk away. Meanwhile, the man who had lost work and his reputation and a shit ton of money on legal representation has now go after the state for bringing the case against him when they had evidence to prove his innocence. Instead of "believe her" it should be "trust nobody until you get the full story".

@Beep Boop That‚Äôs so true! There‚Äôs definitely a disparity in the way male victims are (not) considered, or in how men are treated in civil cases (custody matters taking the cake here). When it comes to men as perpetrators, though, it goes both ways with the issues. There is a very real bias in that sense, but it‚Äôs not the whole story at all.

I was just reading an article, for example, that mentioned only 3.5% of reported cases of rape (a predominantly gender-based crime, especially in adulthood) in England and Wales were prosecuted this year, and 2.3% led to conviction. That‚Äôs insane, especially considering it‚Äôs estimated that only 15% of victims actually report sexual offenses to the police. You can‚Äôt read that and maintain that the legal system or society truly favor women. For every man who‚Äôs unjustly prosecuted based on stereotypes, there‚Äôs likely several that got away with stuff. And those statistics are from the same country in which Depp somehow lost the libel case against the Sun. The legal system really fails men and women both.
